

With a randomly generated binary number with 2 masks, 
all the possible combinations are as follows for: *11111100100*01

011111100100001
011111100100101
111111100100001
111111100100101

This current run took 38ms


With a randomly generated binary number with 4 masks, 
all the possible combinations are as follows for: *1*100*0101100*1

0101000010110001
0101000010110011
0101001010110001
0101001010110011
0111000010110001
0111000010110011
0111001010110001
0111001010110011
1101000010110001
1101000010110011
1101001010110001
1101001010110011
1111000010110001
1111000010110011
1111001010110001
1111001010110011

This current run took 74ms


With a randomly generated binary number with 6 masks, 
all the possible combinations are as follows for: 1000*11**1**1*101000

10000110010010101000
10000110010011101000
10000110010110101000
10000110010111101000
10000110011010101000
10000110011011101000

This current run took 426ms

At this point showing all the combinations will take far too long to output in this document. 
so im going to just print the elapsed time to this document for numbers of stars
and print the stars to my console

This current run of 8 masks took 34ms

This current run of 10 masks took 43ms

This current run of 12 masks took 86ms

This current run of 14 masks took 140ms

This current run of 16 masks took 334ms

This current run of 18 masks took 1540ms

This current run of 20 masks took 4092ms

This current run of 22 masks took 14099ms

This current run of 24 masks took 60011ms

This current run of 26 masks took 219665ms

Anything past this amount of masks starts to take a crazy amount of time
